moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nd2 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nd: So far a book line, with a slight edge for White because Black has ceded the center to some extent.
moves.7... b6: Black needs to get the Bishop out, but has to be very careful of tactics.
moves.8. Ne5: A strong response. If Black takes the N, White controls e5.
moves.8... Bb7: ?? This natural looking move loses outright. Black has fallen into a subtle opening trap. So how does White win?
moves.12. Nxg7+ Kf7 13. Qe6+: ! A strong response. Black has bad choices.
moves.13... Kxg7: This loses, but so does ... Kf8 Bh6!
moves.14. Qxe7+ Kg8 15. Bc4+: Bh6 wins the Q since that is the only way to stop mate, but this is even stronger, forcing mate.
moves.15... Bd5 16. Bxd5+ Nxd5 17. Qe6+: Now the Black K has to go to either f8 or g7.
